result.execSummary:
The defendant David R Rockman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
ATTEND One alumni meeting per month.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David R Rockman in court with Attorney Eric Theodore Raskopf.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made.   Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.
